Web3sdksSDK.name: Web3sdksSDK
Web3sdksSDK.summary: The main entry point for the web3sdks SDK

methods.name: fromPrivateKey
methods.summary: Get an instance of the web3sdks SDK based on a private key.
methods.remarks: This should only be used for backend services or scripts, with the private key stored in a secure way. **NEVER** expose your private key to the public in any way.

examples.javascript: const sdk = Web3sdksSDK.fromPrivateKey("SecretPrivateKey", "mainnet");
examples.react:
const sdk = useSDK();

const sdk = Web3sdksSDK.fromPrivateKey("SecretPrivateKey", "mainnet");
examples.unity: Unity does not support instantiating the SDK from a private key. Instantiate the SDK in read-only mode and then connect the user's Wallet.

methods.name: fromSigner
methods.summary: Get an instance of the web3sdks SDK based on an existing ethers signer

examples.unity: Unity does not support instantiating the SDK from a signer. Instantiate the SDK in read-only mode and then connect the user's Wallet.

methods.name: fromWallet
methods.summary: Get an instance of the web3sdks SDK based on an AbstractWallet

examples.unity: Unity does not support instantiating the SDK from a Wallet. Instantiate the SDK in read-only mode and then connect the user's Wallet.

methods.name: getBalance
methods.summary: Get the native balance of a given address (wallet or contract)

examples.javascript:
const balance = await sdk.getBalance("0x...");
console.log(balance.displayValue);
examples.unity: CurrencyValue balance = await sdk.Wallet.GetBalance();

methods.name: getContract
methods.summary: Get an instance of a Custom Web3sdksContract

examples.javascript: const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
examples.react: const { contract, isLoading, error } = useContract("{{contract_address}}");

methods.name: getContract
methods.summary: Get an instance of a Custom Web3sdksContract

examples.javascript: const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
examples.react: const { contract, isLoading, error } = useContract("{{contract_address}}");

methods.name: getContract
methods.summary: Get an instance of a Custom Web3sdksContract

examples.javascript: const contract = await sdk.getContract("{{contract_address}}");
examples.react: const { contract, isLoading, error } = useContract("{{contract_address}}");

methods.name: getContractFromAbi
methods.summary: Get an instance of a Custom contract from a json ABI

examples.unity: Contract contract = sdk.GetContract("<your-smart-contract-address>", "<your-contract-abi>");

methods.name: getContractList
methods.summary: Return all the contracts deployed by the specified address

examples.javascript: const contracts = sdk.getContractList("{{wallet_address}}");
examples.react:
const sdk = useSDK();

const contracts = sdk.getContractList("{{wallet_address}}");

NFTCollection.name: NFTCollection
NFTCollection.summary: Create a collection of one-of-one NFTs.

examples.python:
from web3sdks import Web3sdksSDK

# You can customize this to a supported network or your own RPC URL
network = "mumbai"

# Now we can create a new instance of the SDK
sdk = Web3sdksSDK(network)

# If you want to send transactions, you can instantiate the SDK with a private key instead:
#   sdk = Web3sdksSDK.from_private_key(PRIVATE_KEY, network)

contract = sdk.get_nft_collection("{{contract_address}}")

examples.javascript: const result = await contract.burnToken(tokenId);
examples.go:
tokenId := 0
tx, err := contract.Burn(context.Background(), tokenId)
examples.react: const result = await contract.burnToken(tokenId);
examples.unity:
var tokenId = "0";
var result = await contract.ERC721.Burn(tokenId);

methods.name: mintBatchTo
methods.remarks: Mint many unique NFTs at once to a specified wallet.

examples.python:
from web3sdks.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput

# You can customize this metadata however you like
metadatas = [
    NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
        "name": "Cool NFT",
        "description": "This is a cool NFT",
        "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
    }),
    NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
        "name": "Cooler NFT",
        "description": "This is a cooler NFT",
        "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
    }),
]

# You can pass in any address here to mint the NFT to
txs = contract.mint_batch_to("{{wallet_address}}", metadatas)
receipt = txs[0].receipt
first_token_id = txs[0].id
first_nft = txs[0].data()

methods.name: mintTo
methods.remarks: Mint a unique NFT to a specified wallet.

examples.python:
from web3sdks.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput

# Note that you can customize this metadata however you like
metadata = NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
    "name": "Cool NFT",
    "description": "This is a cool NFT",
    "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
})

# You can pass in any address here to mint the NFT to
tx = contract.mint_to("{{wallet_address}}", metadata)
receipt = tx.receipt
token_id = tx.id
nft = tx.data()
examples.go:
image, err := os.Open("path/to/image.jpg")
defer image.Close()

metadata := &web3sdks.NFTMetadataInput{
	Name: "Cool NFT",
	Description: "This is a cool NFT",
	Image: image,
}

tx, err := contract.MintTo(context.Background(), "{{wallet_address}}", metadata)

methods.name: balanceOf
methods.remarks: Get a wallets NFT balance (number of NFTs in this contract owned by the wallet).

examples.go:
address := "{{wallet_address}}"
balance, err := contract.BalanceOf(context.Background(), address)

examples.javascript:
const tokenId = 0;
const nft = await contract.get(tokenId);
examples.go:
nft, err := contract.Get(context.Background(), 0)
 owner := nft.Owner
	name := nft.Metadata.Name
examples.react:
const tokenId = 0;
const nft = await contract.get(tokenId);
examples.unity:
var tokenId = "0";
var nft = await contract.ERC721.Get(tokenId);

methods.name: getAll
methods.remarks:
Get all the data associated with every NFT in this contract.

By default, returns the first 100 NFTs, use queryParams to fetch more.

examples.javascript:
const nfts = await contract.getAll();
console.log(nfts);
examples.go:
nfts, err := contract.GetAll(context.Background())
ownerOne := nfts[0].Owner
nameOne := nfts[0].Metadata.Name
examples.react:
const nfts = await contract.getAll();
console.log(nfts);
examples.unity:
var nfts = await contract.ERC721.GetAll();
Debug.Log(nfts);

methods.name: getOwned
methods.remarks: Get all the data associated with the NFTs owned by a specific wallet.

examples.go:
owner := "{{wallet_address}}"
nfts, err := contract.GetOwned(context.Background(), owner)
name := nfts[0].Metadata.Name

methods.name: transfer
methods.remarks: Transfer an NFT from the connected wallet to another wallet.

examples.go:
to := "0x..."
tokenId := 0

tx, err := contract.Transfer(context.Background(), to, tokenId)

properties.name: royalties
properties.remarks: Set your own royalties for the entire contract or per token

properties.name: signature
properties.remarks: Generate dynamic NFTs with your own signature, and let others mint them using that signature.

Edition.name: Edition
Edition.summary: Create a collection of NFTs that lets you mint multiple copies of each NFT.

examples.python:
from web3sdks import Web3sdksSDK

# You can customize this to a supported network or your own RPC URL
network = "mumbai"

# Now we can create a new instance of the SDK
sdk = Web3sdksSDK(network)

# If you want to send transactions, you can instantiate the SDK with a private key instead:
#   sdk = Web3sdksSDK.from_private_key(PRIVATE_KEY, network)

contract = sdk.get_edition("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: burn
methods.summary: Burn a specified amount of a NFT

examples.javascript: const result = await contract.burnTokens(tokenId, amount);
examples.go:
tokenId := 0
amount := 1
tx, err := contract.Burn(context.Background(), tokenId, amount)
examples.react: const result = await contract.burnTokens(tokenId, amount);

methods.name: getAll
methods.remarks:
Get all the data associated with every NFT in this contract.

By default, returns the first 100 NFTs, use queryParams to fetch more.

examples.javascript: const nfts = await contract.getAll();
examples.go:
nfts, err := contract.GetAll(context.Background())
supplyOne := nfts[0].Supply
nameOne := nfts[0].Metadata.Name
examples.react: const nfts = await contract.getAll();
examples.unity: var nfts = await contract.ERC1155.GetAll();

methods.name: getOwned
methods.remarks: Get all the data associated with the NFTs owned by a specific wallet.

examples.go:
owner := "{{wallet_address}}"
nfts, err := contract.GetOwned(context.Background(), owner)
name := nfts[0].Metadata.Name

methods.name: mintBatchTo
methods.summary: Mint Many NFTs with limited supplies
methods.remarks: Mint many different NFTs with limited supplies to a specified wallet.

examples.python:
from web3sdks.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput, EditionMetadataInput

# Note that you can customize this metadata however you like
metadatas_with_supply = [
    EditionMetadataInput(
        NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
            "name": "Cool NFT",
            "description": "This is a cool NFT",
            "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
        }),
        100
    ),
    EditionMetadataInput(
        NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
            "name": "Cooler NFT",
            "description": "This is a cooler NFT",
            "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
        }),
        100
    )
]

# You can pass in any address here to mint the NFT to
txs = contract.mint_batch_to("{{wallet_address}}", metadatas_with_supply)
receipt = txs[0].receipt
token_id = txs[0].id
nft = txs[0].data()

methods.name: mintTo
methods.summary: Mint an NFT with a limited supply
methods.remarks: Mint an NFT with a limited supply to a specified wallet.

examples.python:
from web3sdks.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput, EditionMetadataInput

# Note that you can customize this metadata however you like
metadata_with_supply = EditionMetadataInput(
    NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
        "name": "Cool NFT",
        "description": "This is a cool NFT",
        "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
    }),
    100
)

# You can pass in any address here to mint the NFT to
tx = contract.mint_to("{{wallet_address}}", metadata_with_supply)
receipt = tx.receipt
token_id = tx.id
nft = tx.data()

methods.name: airdrop
balanceOf
methods.remarks: Get a wallets NFT balance (number of NFTs in this contract owned by the wallet).

examples.go:
address := "{{wallet_address}}"
tokenId := 0
balance, err := contract.BalanceOf(context.Background(), address, tokenId)

examples.javascript: const nft = await contract.get("0");
examples.go:
nft, err := contract.Get(context.Background(), 0)
 supply := nft.Supply
	name := nft.Metadata.Name
examples.react: const nft = await contract.get("0");
examples.unity: var nft = await contract.ERC1155.Get("0");

methods.name: transfer
methods.remarks: Transfer an NFT from the connected wallet to another wallet.

examples.python:
to = "{{wallet_address}}"
token_id = 0
amount = 1

receipt = contract.transfer(to, token_id, amount)
examples.go:
to := "0x..."
tokenId := 0
amount := 1

tx, err := contract.Transfer(context.Background(), to, tokenId, amount)

properties.name: royalties
properties.remarks: Set your own royalties for the entire contract or per token

properties.name: signature
properties.remarks: Generate dynamic NFTs with your own signature, and let others mint them using that signature.

TokenDrop.name: TokenDrop
TokenDrop.summary: Create a Drop contract for a standard crypto token or cryptocurrency.

methods.name: burnFrom
methods.remarks: Burn tokens held by the specified wallet

methods.name: burnTokens
methods.remarks: Burn tokens held by the connected wallet

methods.name: claimTo
methods.summary: Claim a certain amount of tokens to a specific Wallet
methods.remarks: Let the specified wallet claim Tokens.

examples.javascript:
const address = "{{wallet_address}}"; // address of the wallet you want to claim the NFTs
const quantity = 42.69; // how many tokens you want to claim

const tx = await contract.claimTo(address, quantity);
const receipt = tx.receipt; // the transaction receipt
examples.react:
const address = "{{wallet_address}}"; // address of the wallet you want to claim the NFTs
const quantity = 42.69; // how many tokens you want to claim

const tx = await contract.claimTo(address, quantity);
const receipt = tx.receipt; // the transaction receipt
examples.unity:
var address = "{{wallet_address}}"; // address of the wallet you want to claim the NFTs
var quantity = 1; // how many tokens you want to claim

var tx = await contract.ERC20.ClaimTo(address, quantity);
var receipt = tx.receipt; // the transaction receipt

methods.name: allowance
methods.remarks: Get the allowance of a 'spender' wallet over the connected wallet's funds - the allowance of a different address for a token is the amount of tokens that the `spender` wallet is allowed to spend on behalf of the connected wallet.

methods.name: allowanceOf
methods.remarks: Get the allowance of one wallet over another wallet's funds - the allowance of a different address for a token is the amount of tokens that the wallet is allowed to spend on behalf of the specified wallet.

methods.name: balance
methods.summary: Get Token Balance for the currently connected wallet
methods.remarks: Get a wallets token balance.

examples.javascript: const balance = await contract.balance();
examples.react: const balance = await contract.balance();
examples.unity: var balance = await contract.ERC20.Balance();

methods.name: balanceOf
methods.remarks: Get a wallets token balance.

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Get the token Metadata (name, symbol, etc...)

examples.javascript: const token = await contract.get();
examples.react: const token = await contract.get();
examples.unity: var token = await contract.ERC20.Get();

methods.name: setAllowance
methods.summary: Allows the specified `spender` wallet to transfer the given `amount` of tokens to another wallet

methods.name: totalSupply
methods.summary: The total supply for this Token
methods.remarks: Get how much supply has been minted

examples.javascript: const balance = await contract.totalSupply();
examples.react: const balance = await contract.totalSupply();
examples.unity: var balance = await contract.ERC20.TotalSupply();

methods.name: transfer
methods.remarks: Transfer tokens from the connected wallet to another wallet.

methods.name: transferBatch
methods.remarks: Mint tokens from the connected wallet to many wallets

methods.name: transferFrom
methods.remarks: Transfer tokens from one wallet to another

properties.name: claimConditions
properties.remarks: Define who can claim Tokens, when and how many.

Token.name: Token
Token.summary: Create a standard crypto token or cryptocurrency.

examples.python:
from web3sdks import Web3sdksSDK

# You can customize this to a supported network or your own RPC URL
network = "mumbai"

# Now we can create a new instance of the SDK
sdk = Web3sdksSDK(network)

# If you want to send transactions, you can instantiate the SDK with a private key instead:
#   sdk = Web3sdksSDK.from_private_key(PRIVATE_KEY, network)

contract = sdk.get_token("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: burn
methods.remarks: Burn tokens held by the connected wallet

examples.go:
amount := 1
tx, err := contract.Burn(context.Background(), amount)

methods.name: burnFrom
methods.remarks: Burn tokens held by the specified wallet

examples.go:
holder := "0x..."
amount := 1

tx, err := contract.BurnFrom(context.Background(), holder, amount)

methods.name: mintBatchTo
methods.remarks: Mint tokens to many wallets in one transaction.

examples.python:
from web3sdks.types.currency import TokenAmount

args = [
    TokenAmount("{{wallet_address}}", 1),
    TokenAmount("{{wallet_address}}", 2),
]

contract.mint_batch_to(args)

methods.name: mintTo
methods.remarks: Mint tokens to a specified address.

examples.go: tx, err := contract.MintTo(context.Background(), "{{wallet_address}}", 1)

methods.name: allowance
methods.remarks: Get the allowance of a 'spender' wallet over the connected wallet's funds - the allowance of a different address for a token is the amount of tokens that the `spender` wallet is allowed to spend on behalf of the connected wallet.

examples.go:
spender := "0x..."

allowance, err := contract.Allowance(spender)
allowanceValue := allowance.DisplayValue

methods.name: allowanceOf
methods.remarks: Get the allowance of one wallet over another wallet's funds - the allowance of a different address for a token is the amount of tokens that the wallet is allowed to spend on behalf of the specified wallet.

examples.python:
# Address of the wallet who owns the funds
address = "{{wallet_address}}"

# Address of the wallet to check the token allowance
spender = "0x..."

allowance = contract.allowance_of(address, spender)
print(allowance)
examples.go:
address := "{{wallet_address}}"
spender := "0x..."

allowance, err := contract.AllowanceOf(address, spender)
allowanceValue := allowance.DisplayValue

methods.name: balance
methods.summary: Get Token Balance for the currently connected wallet
methods.remarks: Get a wallets token balance.

examples.javascript: const balance = await contract.balance();
examples.go:
balance, err := contract.Balance()
 balanceValue := balance.DisplayValue
examples.react: const balance = await contract.balance();
examples.unity: var balance = await contract.ERC20.Balance();

methods.name: balanceOf
methods.remarks: Get a wallets token balance.

examples.go:
address := "{{wallet_address}}"
	balance, err := contract.BalanceOf()
 balanceValue := balance.DisplayValue

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Get the token Metadata (name, symbol, etc...)

examples.javascript: const token = await contract.get();
examples.go:

symbol := currency.Symbol
examples.react: const token = await contract.get();
examples.unity: var token = await contract.ERC20.Get();

examples.go:
spender := "0x..."
amount := 1

tx, err := contract.SetAllowance(context.Background(), spender, amount)

methods.name: totalSupply
methods.summary: The total supply for this Token
methods.remarks: Get how much supply has been minted

examples.javascript: const balance = await contract.totalSupply();
examples.react: const balance = await contract.totalSupply();

methods.name: transfer

contract.transfer(to, amount)

methods.name: transferBatch
methods.remarks: Mint tokens from the connected wallet to many wallets

examples.python:
from web3sdks.types.currency import TokenAmount

data = [
    TokenAmount("{{wallet_address}}", 0.1),

methods.name: transferFrom
methods.remarks: Transfer tokens from one wallet to another

examples.python:
# Address to send tokens from
fr = "{{wallet_address}}"

# Address to send tokens to
to = "0x..."

# Amount of tokens to transfer
amount = 0.1

contract.transfer_from(fr, to, amount)
examples.go:
from := "{{wallet_address}}"
to := "0x..."
amount := 1

tx, err := contract.TransferFrom(context.Background(), from, to, amount)

properties.name: signature
properties.remarks: Generate tokens that can be minted only with your own signature, attaching your own set of mint conditions.

NFTDrop.name: NFTDrop
NFTDrop.summary: Setup a collection of one-of-one NFTs that are minted as users claim them.

examples.python:
from web3sdks import Web3sdksSDK

# You can customize this to a supported network or your own RPC URL
network = "mumbai"

# Now we can create a new instance of the SDK
sdk = Web3sdksSDK(network)

# If you want to send transactions, you can instantiate the SDK with a private key instead:
#   sdk = Web3sdksSDK.from_private_key(PRIVATE_KEY, network)

contract = sdk.get_nft_drop("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: balanceOf
methods.remarks: Get a wallets NFT balance (number of NFTs in this contract owned by the wallet).

examples.go:
address := "{{wallet_address}}"
balance, err := contract.BalanceOf(context.Background(), address)

examples.javascript: const result = await contract.burnToken(tokenId);
examples.go:
tokenId := 0
tx, err := contract.Burn(context.Background(), tokenId)
examples.react: const result = await contract.burnToken(tokenId);
examples.unity:
var tokenId = "0";
var result = await contract.ERC721.Burn(tokenId);

methods.name: claimTo
methods.summary: Claim unique NFTs to a specific Wallet
methods.remarks: Let the specified wallet claim NFTs.

examples.javascript:
const address = "{{wallet_address}}"; // address of the wallet you want to claim the NFTs
const quantity = 1; // how many unique NFTs you want to claim

const tx = await contract.claimTo(address, quantity);
const receipt = tx[0].receipt; // the transaction receipt
const claimedTokenId = tx[0].id; // the id of the NFT claimed
const claimedNFT = await tx[0].data(); // (optional) get the claimed NFT metadata
examples.python:
address = {{wallet_address}}
quantity = 1

tx = contract.claim_to(address, quantity)
receipt = tx.receipt
claimed_token_id = tx.id
claimed_nft = tx.data()
examples.go:
address := "{{wallet_address}}"
quantity = 1

tx, err := contract.ClaimTo(context.Background(), address, quantity)
examples.react:
const address = "{{wallet_address}}"; // address of the wallet you want to claim the NFTs
const quantity = 1; // how many unique NFTs you want to claim

const tx = await contract.claimTo(address, quantity);
const receipt = tx[0].receipt; // the transaction receipt
const claimedTokenId = tx[0].id; // the id of the NFT claimed
const claimedNFT = await tx[0].data(); // (optional) get the claimed NFT metadata

methods.name: createBatch
methods.summary: Create a batch of unique NFTs to be claimed in the future
methods.remarks: Create batch allows you to create a batch of many unique NFTs in one transaction.

examples.python:
from web3sdks.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput

# You can customize this metadata however you like
metadatas = [
    NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
        "name": "Cool NFT",
        "description": "This is a cool NFT",
        "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
    }),
    NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
        "name": "Cooler NFT",
        "description": "This is a cooler NFT",
        "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
    }),
]

txs = contract.create_batch(metadatas)
first_token_id = txs[0].id
first_nft = txs[0].data()

examples.javascript:
const tokenId = 0;
const nft = await contract.get(tokenId);
examples.go:
nft, err := contract.Get(context.Background(), 0)
 owner := nft.Owner
	name := nft.Metadata.Name
examples.react:
const tokenId = 0;
const nft = await contract.get(tokenId);
examples.unity:
var tokenId = "0";
var nft = await contract.ERC721.Get(tokenId);

methods.name: getAllClaimed
methods.remarks:
Fetch all the NFTs (and their owners) that have been claimed in this Drop.

*

examples.javascript:
const claimedNFTs = await contract.getAllClaimed();
const firstOwner = claimedNFTs[0].owner;
examples.go:
claimedNfts, err := contract.GetAllClaimed(context.Background())
firstOwner := claimedNfts[0].Owner
examples.react:
const claimedNFTs = await contract.getAllClaimed();
const firstOwner = claimedNFTs[0].owner;

methods.name: getAllUnclaimed
methods.remarks:
Fetch all the NFTs that have been not been claimed yet in this Drop.

*

examples.javascript:
const unclaimedNFTs = await contract.getAllUnclaimed();
const firstUnclaimedNFT = unclaimedNFTs[0].name;
examples.go:
unclaimedNfts, err := contract.GetAllUnclaimed(context.Background())
firstNftName := unclaimedNfts[0].Name
examples.react:
const unclaimedNFTs = await contract.getAllUnclaimed();
const firstUnclaimedNFT = unclaimedNFTs[0].name;

methods.name: totalClaimedSupply
methods.remarks:
Get the number of claimed NFTs in this Drop.

*

examples.javascript:
const claimedNFTCount = await contract.totalClaimedSupply();
console.log(`NFTs claimed so far: ${claimedNFTCount}`);
examples.react:
const claimedNFTCount = await contract.totalClaimedSupply();
console.log(`NFTs claimed so far: ${claimedNFTCount}`);
examples.unity: var claimedNFTCount = await contract.ERC721.TotalClaimedSupply();

methods.name: totalUnclaimedSupply
methods.remarks:
Get the number of unclaimed NFTs in this Drop.

*

examples.javascript:
const unclaimedNFTCount = await contract.totalUnclaimedSupply();
console.log(`NFTs left to claim: ${unclaimedNFTCount}`);
examples.react:
const unclaimedNFTCount = await contract.totalUnclaimedSupply();
console.log(`NFTs left to claim: ${unclaimedNFTCount}`);
examples.unity: var unclaimedNFTCount = await contract.ERC721.TotalUnclaimedSupply();

methods.remarks: Transfer an NFT from the connected wallet to another wallet.

examples.go:
to := "0x..."
tokenId := 0

tx, err := contract.Transfer(context.Background(), to, tokenId)

	name := nft.Metadata.Name

EditionDrop.name: EditionDrop
EditionDrop.summary: Setup a collection of NFTs with a customizable number of each NFT that are minted as users claim them.

examples.python:
from web3sdks import Web3sdksSDK

# You can customize this to a supported network or your own RPC URL
network = "mumbai"

# Now we can create a new instance of the SDK
sdk = Web3sdksSDK(network)

# If you want to send transactions, you can instantiate the SDK with a private key instead:
#   sdk = Web3sdksSDK.from_private_key(PRIVATE_KEY, network)

contract = sdk.get_edition_drop("{{contract_address}}")

examples.react: const result = await contract.burnTokens(tokenId, amount);

methods.name: claimTo
methods.summary: Claim NFTs to a specific Wallet
methods.remarks: Let the specified wallet claim NFTs.

examples.javascript:
const address = "{{wallet_address}}"; // address of the wallet you want to claim the NFTs
const tokenId = 0; // the id of the NFT you want to claim
const quantity = 1; // how many NFTs you want to claim

const tx = await contract.claimTo(address, tokenId, quantity);
const receipt = tx.receipt; // the transaction receipt
examples.python:
address = {{wallet_address}}
token_id = 0
quantity = 1

tx = contract.claim_to(address, token_id, quantity)
receipt = tx.receipt
claimed_token_id = tx.id
claimed_nft = tx.data()
examples.go:

tokenId = 0
quantity = 1

tx, err := contract.ClaimTo(context.Background(), address, tokenId, quantity)
examples.react:

const quantity = 1; // how many NFTs you want to claim

const tx = await contract.claimTo(address, tokenId, quantity);
const receipt = tx.receipt; // the transaction receipt

Marketplace.name: Marketplace
Marketplace.summary: Create your own whitelabel marketplace that enables users to buy and sell any digital assets.

examples.python:
from web3sdks import Web3sdksSDK

# You can customize this to a supported network or your own RPC URL
network = "mumbai"

# Now we can create a new instance of the SDK
sdk = Web3sdksSDK(network)

# If you want to send transactions, you can instantiate the SDK with a private key instead:
#   sdk = Web3sdksSDK.from_private_key(PRIVATE_KEY, network)

contract = sdk.get_marketplace("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: buyoutListing
methods.remarks: Buy a Direct or Auction listing on your marketplace.

methods.name: getActiveListings
methods.remarks: Fetch all the active listings from this marketplace contract. An active listing means it can be bought or bid on.

examples.javascript:
const listings = await contract.getActiveListings();
const priceOfFirstActiveListing = listings[0].price;
examples.react:
const listings = await contract.getActiveListings();
const priceOfFirstActiveListing = listings[0].price;
examples.unity: var listings = await contract.GetActiveListings();

methods.name: getAllListings
methods.remarks: Fetch all the listings from this marketplace contract, including sold ones.

examples.javascript:
const listings = await contract.getAllListings();
const priceOfFirstListing = listings[0].price;
examples.react:
const listings = await contract.getAllListings();
const priceOfFirstListing = listings[0].price;
examples.unity: var listings = await contract.GetAllListings();

methods.name: getListing
methods.summary: Convenience function to get either a direct or auction listing
methods.remarks: Get a listing by its listing id

examples.javascript:
const listingId = 0;
const listing = await contract.getListing(listingId);
examples.go:
listingId := 0
listing, err := marketplace.GetListing(context.Background(), listingId)
examples.react:
const listingId = 0;
const listing = await contract.getListing(listingId);
examples.unity:
var listingId = "0";
var listing = await contract.GetListing(listingId);

methods.name: getOffers
methods.summary: Get all the offers for a listing
methods.remarks: Fetch all the offers for a specified direct or auction listing.

examples.javascript:
const offers = await marketplaceContract.getOffers(listingId);
const firstOffer = offers[0];
examples.react:
const offers = await marketplaceContract.getOffers(listingId);
const firstOffer = offers[0];
examples.unity:
string listingId = "0";
await contract.GetOffers(listingId);

methods.name: makeOffer
methods.summary: Make an offer for a Direct or Auction Listing
methods.remarks: Make an offer on a direct or auction listing

methods.name: setBidBufferBps
methods.remarks: A percentage (e.g. 5%) in basis points (5% = 500, 100% = 10000). A new bid is considered to be a winning bid only if its bid amount is at least the bid buffer (e.g. 5%) greater than the previous winning bid. This prevents buyers from making very slightly higher bids to win the auctioned items.

methods.name: setTimeBufferInSeconds
methods.remarks: Measured in seconds (e.g. 15 minutes or 900 seconds). If a winning bid is made within the buffer of the auction closing (e.g. 15 minutes within the auction closing), the auction's closing time is increased by the buffer to prevent buyers from making last minute winning bids, and to give time to other buyers to make a higher bid if they wish to.

properties.name: auction
properties.remarks: Create and manage auctions in your marketplace.

properties.name: direct
properties.remarks: Create and manage direct listings in your marketplace.

methods.name: acceptOffer
methods.summary: Accept an offer on a direct listing
methods.remarks: Accept an offer on a direct listing

methods.name: buyoutListing
methods.remarks: Buy a specific direct listing from the marketplace.

methods.name: cancelListing
methods.remarks: Cancel a direct listing on the marketplace

examples.unity:
string listingId = "0";
await contract.direct.CancelListing(listingId);

methods.name: createListing
methods.remarks: Create a new listing on the marketplace where people can buy an asset directly.

examples.unity:
await contract
    .direct
    .CreateListing(new NewDirectListing()
    {
        assetContractAddress = "0x...",
        buyoutPricePerToken = "1",
        currencyContractAddress = "0x...",
        listingDurationInSeconds = 3600,
        quantity = 1,
        reservePricePerToken = "0",
        startTimestamp = 0,
        tokenId = "1",
        type = "direct"
    });

methods.remarks: Make an offer on a direct listing

methods.remarks: Buy a specific direct listing from the marketplace.

methods.name: cancelListing
methods.remarks: Cancel an auction listing on the marketplace

methods.summary: Close the Auction for the buyer or the seller
methods.remarks: Closes the Auction and executes the sale for the buyer or the seller.

await contract.auction.ExecuteSale(listingId);

methods.name: createListing

examples.unity:

    .direct

        assetContractAddress = "0x...",

methods.remarks: Make a bid on an auction listing

Multiwrap.name: Multiwrap
Multiwrap.summary: Multiwrap lets you wrap any number of ERC20, ERC721 and ERC1155 tokens you own into a single wrapped token bundle.

examples.python:
from web3sdks import Web3sdksSDK

# You can customize this to a supported network or your own RPC URL
network = "mumbai"

# Now we can create a new instance of the SDK
sdk = Web3sdksSDK(network)

# If you want to send transactions, you can instantiate the SDK with a private key instead:
#   sdk = Web3sdksSDK.from_private_key(PRIVATE_KEY, network)

contract = sdk.get_multiwrap("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: getWrappedContents
methods.summary: Get the contents of a wrapped token bundle

examples.python:
token_id = 0
contents = contract.get_wrapped_contents(token_id)
print(contents.erc20_tokens)
print(contents.erc721_tokens)
print(contents.erc1155_tokens)
examples.go:
tokenId := 0
contents, err := contract.GetWrappedContents(tokenId)
erc20Tokens := contents.Erc20Tokens
erc721Tokens := contents.Erc721Tokens
erc1155Tokens := contents.Erc1155Tokens
examples.unity: // Multiwrap is not yet supported in Unity. You can still use the contrat.Read and contract.Write functions to call functions directly.

methods.name: unwrap
methods.summary: Unwrap a wrapped token bundle, and retrieve its contents

examples.javascript: await contract.unwrap(wrappedTokenId);
examples.go:
tokenId := 0
tx, err := contract.Unwrap(context.Background(), tokenId, "")
examples.react: await contract.unwrap(wrappedTokenId);
examples.unity: // Multiwrap is not yet supported in Unity. You can still use the contrat.Read and contract.Write functions to call functions directly.

methods.name: wrap
methods.summary: Wrap any number of ERC20/ERC721/ERC1155 tokens into a single wrapped token

examples.python:
from web3sdks.types import (
    TokensToWrap,
    ERC20Wrappable,
    ERC721Wrappable,
    ERC1155Wrappable,
    NFTMetadataInput,
)

# Contract setup goes here...

tx = contract.wrap(
    TokensToWrap(
        erc20_tokens=[
            ERC20Wrappable(contract_address="0x...", quantity=0.8),
        ],
        erc721_tokens=[
            ERC721Wrappable(contract_address="0x...", token_id=0),
        ],
        erc1155_tokens=[
            ERC1155Wrappable(contract_address="0x...", token_id=0, quantity=1),
        ]
    ),
    NFTMetadataInput(
        name="Wrapped NFT",
        description="This is a wrapped bundle of tokens and NFTs",
        image="ipfs://...",
    )
)

print(tx.receipt, tx.id)
examples.unity: // Multiwrap is not yet supported in Unity. You can still use the contrat.Read and contract.Write functions to call functions directly.

methods.remarks: Will emit an "event" object containing the transaction status ('submitted' and 'completed') and hash

GasCostEstimator.name: GasCostEstimator
GasCostEstimator.summary: Estimates the gas cost of Contract calls

methods.name: currentGasPriceInGwei
methods.summary: Returns the current gas price in gwei
methods.remarks: Get the current gas price in gwei

examples.javascript: const gasCostInGwei = await contract.estimator.currentGasPriceInGwei();
examples.react: const gasCostInGwei = await contract.estimator.currentGasPriceInGwei();

methods.name: gasCostOf
methods.summary: Estimates the cost of gas in native token of the current chain Pass in the same parameters as the contract's function.
methods.remarks: Estimate the cost of gas in native token of the current chain

examples.javascript:
const costOfClaim = await nftDrop?.estimator.gasCostOf("claim", [
  "0x...", // receiver
  1, // quantity
  "0x...", // currency
  1, // price per token
  [], // proofs
  1, // proof max quantity per transaction
]);
examples.react:
const costOfClaim = await nftDrop?.estimator.gasCostOf("claim", [
  "0x...", // receiver
  1, // quantity
  "0x...", // currency
  1, // price per token
  [], // proofs
  1, // proof max quantity per transaction
]);

methods.name: gasLimitOf
methods.summary: Estimates the gas limit of a transaction Pass in the same parameters as the contract's function.
methods.remarks: Estimates the gas limit of a transaction

examples.javascript:

  "0x...", // receiver
  1, // quantity
  "0x...", // currency
  1, // price per token
  [], // proofs
  1, // proof max quantity per transaction
]);
examples.react:
const gasLimitOfClaim = await nftDrop?.estimator.gasLimitOf("claim", [
  "0x...", // receiver
  1, // quantity
  "0x...", // currency
  1, // price per token
  [], // proofs
  1, // proof max quantity per transaction
]);

ContractInterceptor.name: ContractInterceptor
ContractInterceptor.summary: Allows overriding transaction behavior for this contract

methods.name: overrideNextTransaction
methods.summary: The next transaction executed will add/replace any overrides passed via the passed in hook.
methods.remarks: Overridden values will be applied to the next transaction executed.

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Get the metadata of a contract
methods.remarks: Get the metadata of a contract

examples.javascript: const metadata = await contract.metadata.get();
examples.react: const metadata = await contract.metadata.get();

methods.name: set
methods.summary: Set the metadata of a contract
methods.remarks: OVERWRITE the metadata of a contract

methods.name: update
methods.summary: Update the metadata of a contract
methods.remarks: Update the metadata of a contract

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Call this to get a list of addresses that are members of a specific role.
methods.remarks: See {@link ContractRoles.getAll} to get get a list of addresses for all supported roles on the contract.

examples.javascript: const minterAddresses = await contract.roles.get("minter");
examples.react: const minterAddresses = await contract.roles.get("minter");

methods.name: getAll
methods.summary: Call this to get get a list of addresses for all supported roles on the contract.
methods.remarks: See {@link ContractRoles.get} to get a list of addresses that are members of a specific role.

examples.javascript: const rolesAndMembers = await contract.roles.getAll();
examples.react: const rolesAndMembers = await contract.roles.getAll();

methods.name: grant
methods.summary: Call this to grant a role to a specific address.
methods.remarks: Make sure you are sure you want to grant the role to the address.

methods.name: revoke
methods.summary: Call this to revoke a role from a specific address.
methods.remarks:
-- Caution --

This will let you remove yourself from the role, too. If you remove yourself from the admin role, you will no longer be able to administer the contract. There is no way to recover from this.

methods.name: setAll
methods.summary:
Call this to OVERWRITE the list of addresses that are members of specific roles.

Every role in the list will be overwritten with the new list of addresses provided with them. If you want to add or remove addresses for a single address use {@link ContractRoles.grant} and {@link ContractRoles.revoke} respectively instead.

SignatureDrop.name: SignatureDrop
SignatureDrop.summary: Setup a collection of NFTs where when it comes to minting, you can authorize some external party to mint tokens on your contract, and specify what exactly will be minted by that external party..

examples.javascript: const result = await contract.burnToken(tokenId);
examples.react: const result = await contract.burnToken(tokenId);
examples.unity:
var tokenId = "0";
var result = await contract.ERC721.Burn(tokenId);

methods.name: claimTo
methods.summary: Claim unique NFTs to a specific Wallet
methods.remarks: Let the specified wallet claim NFTs.

examples.javascript:
const address = "{{wallet_address}}"; // address of the wallet you want to claim the NFTs
const quantity = 1; // how many unique NFTs you want to claim

const tx = await contract.claimTo(address, quantity);
const receipt = tx.receipt; // the transaction receipt
const claimedTokenId = tx.id; // the id of the NFT claimed
const claimedNFT = await tx.data(); // (optional) get the claimed NFT metadata
examples.react:
const address = "{{wallet_address}}"; // address of the wallet you want to claim the NFTs
const quantity = 1; // how many unique NFTs you want to claim

const tx = await contract.claimTo(address, quantity);
const receipt = tx.receipt; // the transaction receipt
const claimedTokenId = tx.id; // the id of the NFT claimed
const claimedNFT = await tx.data(); // (optional) get the claimed NFT metadata

methods.name: createBatch
methods.summary: Create a batch of unique NFTs to be claimed in the future
methods.remarks: Create batch allows you to create a batch of many unique NFTs in one transaction.

methods.name: getAllClaimed
methods.remarks:
Fetch all the NFTs (and their owners) that have been claimed in this Drop.

*

examples.javascript:
const claimedNFTs = await contract.getAllClaimed();
const firstOwner = claimedNFTs[0].owner;
examples.react:
const claimedNFTs = await contract.getAllClaimed();
const firstOwner = claimedNFTs[0].owner;

methods.name: getAllUnclaimed
methods.remarks:
Fetch all the NFTs that have been not been claimed yet in this Drop.

*

examples.javascript:
const unclaimedNFTs = await contract.getAllUnclaimed();
const firstUnclaimedNFT = unclaimedNFTs[0].name;
examples.react:
const unclaimedNFTs = await contract.getAllUnclaimed();
const firstUnclaimedNFT = unclaimedNFTs[0].name;

methods.name: totalClaimedSupply
methods.remarks:
Get the number of claimed NFTs in this Drop.

*

examples.javascript:
const claimedNFTCount = await contract.totalClaimedSupply();
console.log(`NFTs claimed so far: ${claimedNFTCount}`);
examples.react:
const claimedNFTCount = await contract.totalClaimedSupply();
console.log(`NFTs claimed so far: ${claimedNFTCount}`);
examples.unity: var claimedNFTCount = await contract.ERC721.TotalClaimedSupply();

methods.name: totalUnclaimedSupply
methods.remarks:
Get the number of unclaimed NFTs in this Drop.

*

examples.javascript:
const unclaimedNFTCount = await contract.totalUnclaimedSupply();
console.log(`NFTs left to claim: ${unclaimedNFTCount}`);
examples.react:
const unclaimedNFTCount = await contract.totalUnclaimedSupply();
console.log(`NFTs left to claim: ${unclaimedNFTCount}`);
examples.unity: var unclaimedNFTCount = await contract.ERC721.TotalUnclaimedSupply();

methods.name: balanceOf
methods.remarks: Get a wallets NFT balance (number of NFTs in this contract owned by the wallet).

examples.javascript:
const tokenId = 0;
const nft = await contract.get(tokenId);
examples.react:
const tokenId = 0;
const nft = await contract.get(tokenId);
examples.unity:
var tokenId = "0";
var nft = await contract.ERC721.Get(tokenId);

methods.name: getAll
methods.remarks:
Get all the data associated with every NFT in this contract.

By default, returns the first 100 NFTs, use queryParams to fetch more.

examples.javascript:
const nfts = await contract.getAll();
console.log(nfts);
examples.react:
const nfts = await contract.getAll();
console.log(nfts);
examples.unity:
var nfts = await contract.ERC721.GetAll();
Debug.Log(nfts);

methods.name: getOwned
methods.remarks: Get all the data associated with the NFTs owned by a specific wallet.

methods.name: transfer
methods.remarks: Transfer an NFT from the connected wallet to another wallet.

properties.name: claimConditions
properties.remarks: Define who can claim NFTs in the collection, when and how many.

properties.name: revealer
properties.remarks: Create a batch of encrypted NFTs that can be revealed at a later time.

properties.name: royalties
properties.remarks: Set your own royalties for the entire contract or per token

properties.name: signature
properties.remarks: Generate dynamic NFTs with your own signature, and let others mint them using that signature.

SmartContract.name: SmartContract
SmartContract.summary: Custom contract dynamic class with feature detection

methods.name: call
methods.summary: Call any function on this contract

examples.python:
# We specify the domain of the application to authenticate to
domain = "example.com"

# We can then generate a payload for the connected wallet to login
# This can also be done on the client side with the web3sdks TypeScript SDK
payload = sdk.auth.login(domain)

# Then, on the server, we can securely verify the connected address that signed the payload
address = sdk.auth.verify(domain, payload)

# And we can also generate an authentication token to send back to the original payload sender
token = sdk.auth.generate_auth_token(domain, payload)

# Finally, the token can be use dby the original payload sender to authenticate to the backend
# And the server can use the following function to authenticate the token and verify the address
address = sdk.auth.authenticate(domain, token)

methods.name: authenticate
methods.remarks: Server-side function that authenticates the provided JWT token. This function verifies that the provided authentication token is valid and returns the address of the authenticated wallet.

examples.python:
domain = "example.com"
payload = sdk.auth.login(domain)
token = sdk.auth.generate_auth_token(domain, payload)

# Authenticate the token and get the address of the authenticating wallet
address = sdk.auth.authenticate(domain, token)
examples.go:
domain := "example.com"
payload, err := sdk.Auth.Login(domain)
token, err := sdk.Auth.GenerateAuthToken(domain, payload)

// Authenticate the token and get the address of the authenticating wallet
address, err := sdk.Auth.Authenticate(domain, token)

methods.name: generateAuthToken
methods.remarks: Server-side function that generates a JWT token from the provided login request that the client-side wallet can use to authenticate to the server-side application.

examples.python:
domain = "example.com"
payload = sdk.auth.login(domain)

# Generate an authentication token for the logged in wallet
token = sdk.auth.generate_auth_token(domain, payload)
examples.go:
domain := "example.com"
payload, err := sdk.Auth.Login(domain, nil)

// Generate an authentication token for the logged in wallet
token, err := sdk.Auth.GenerateAuthToken(domain, payload, nil)

methods.name: login
methods.remarks: Client-side function that allows the connected wallet to login to a server-side application. Generates a login payload that can be sent to the server-side for verification or authentication.

examples.python:
# Add the domain of the application that you want to log in to
domain = "example.com"

# Generate a signed login payload for the connected wallet to authenticate with
payload = sdk.auth.login(domain)
examples.unity: // Login is not available in the Unity SDK.

methods.name: verify
methods.remarks: Server-side function to securely verify the address of the logged in client-side wallet by validating the provided client-side login request.

examples.python:
domain = "example.com"
payload = sdk.auth.login(domain)

# Verify the login request
address = sdk.auth.verify(domain, payload)
examples.go:
domain := "example.com"
payload, err := sdk.Auth.Login(domain, nil)

// Verify the login request
address, err := sdk.Auth.Verify(domain, payload, nil)
examples.unity:
// Generating an authentication token is a server-side admin operation.
 For this reason, it is not available in the Unity SDK.

UserWallet.name: UserWallet
UserWallet.summary: Connect and Interact with a user wallet

examples.javascript: const balance = await sdk.wallet.balance();

methods.name: balance
methods.summary: Fetch the native or ERC20 token balance of this wallet

examples.unity: await sdk.wallet.GetBalance();

examples.javascript: const address = await sdk.wallet.getAddress();
examples.unity: await sdk.wallet.GetAddress();

methods.name: recoverAddress

examples.unity: await sdk.wallet.RecoverAddress("message", "signature");

methods.name: sign
methods.summary: Sign any message with the connected wallet private key

examples.unity: await sdk.wallet.Sign("message");

methods.name: signTypedData
methods.summary: Sign a typed data structure (EIP712) with the connected wallet private key

methods.name: transfer

examples.unity: await sdk.wallet.Transfer("to", "amount", "currencyAddress");
